description.summaryDescription: This chalk drawing was a breakthrough for me in that it made a break from the darker palette and mood I had become accustomed to. Sat on a bench near the river Itchen in the late Autumn I a calm ectasy as this new way of working flowed easily and intuitively.

title: Water-Meadows and St. Catherine's Hill, End of Summer
description: Many times I had walked past this place near St.Cross in Winchester, and had not full recongised its specialness. One morning, the last day of Autumn, I mustered the energy and walked out with heavy bags of painting equipment and relished every moment of the experience of painting this remarkable scene. The scene reminded me of the golden heavenly realms of Poussing or Balthus, and I hope I came some way to communicating this.
